author: SS
text:
I used to shop the RealReal constantly, I’m one of those who “invests” in retail as therapy & constantly look for unique pieces. AKA shopaholic.  Found many great pieces over the years but quality has tanked. 

 RR was the only “re-sale” venue I use/ used, I’ll likely stick to Sak’s/ Nordstrom, etc. moving forward.  
The last two purchases have been (1) a disaster and the second, extremely disappointing.

1: Roland Mouret dress, arrived with an obviously broken zipper, half back zip - dress hanging open with the zipper hanging 1/2 way down & missing the top counterpart.  The label was attached via a safety pin, it could have been attached to any dress (so much for authenticity).  Neither was noted under ‘condition’, it was listed as “very good”.  Customer service was shockingly rude & unhelpful, especially given the literal  thousands I’ve spent at RR.  They didn’t even offer to pay for shipping to send it back.  
A year 1/2 later I decided to give them another try.  One of the shirts purchased, listed as “very good”, looked so used my sister said it should be donated when we were purging my closet.  Pilled & the color was super faded.  Another dress had armpit stains,...  it’s not a deal if you can’t used the clothes you buy.  
If you decide to purchase from RR, I suggest New With Tags, Only (although, back in the day I was burned once with a NWT purchase as well).  
I doubt I’ll be using RR for retail much if at all in the future.
title: Disappointing & on occasion, outright theft/  false advertising to the extreme

author: Kate Spade ♠️ fan
text: I bought a dress. First time purchase from your site. It came in damaged. I reported and requested return instructions. Then no response. Disappointing lack of communication and a damaged red Kate Spade dress. I've been loyal to another site and their practices are excellent. That might be where my disappointment lies. I think I thought all site would be that great. Thanks anyway.
title: I own a damaged red dress.

author: S.L.
text: I'm very disappointed with my first purchase with RealReal. I knew it was pre-owned and I knew it was graded as only "good" but the description failed to mention that the inner lining was completely torn. Had I known that I would've chosen a different bag. Now I question the accuracy of the description on the website. It's one thing to miss a minor scratch but a completely torn inner lining cannot be missed. Whether it was left out intentionally would be arguable, to say the least. I'm not sure I would purchase again with such subpar first impression.
title: Very disappointed
